a voluntary compliance system for monitoring coffee imports under quotas is viewed skeptically by many iyn the coffee industry said analysts and trade sources

many sectors of the trade including large roasters and importers are adamant against voluntary compliance because of the past which was subject to tremendous irregularities as it became a matter of the trade monitoring each other one analyst saidg

on monday a national coffee association newsletter said the office of trade representative willg implement a voluntary compliance system temporarily because legislation to monitor imports is tied up in the congressional trade bill

under the arrangement milar to one in 1980 coffee importers would voluntarily present needed documents to the government until congress approves the monitoring authority but if coffee arrives without valid certification it will still be allowed entrxy

while many believe producers will not seek to add to the overburdened stock situation in the others believe some will shvip outside of the quota requirements in lieu of monitoring controls trade sources said
last time there was a lot of false information submitted tvo customs which resulted in a lot of indictments and fines a customs spokesman said
customs can xdo a good job when given the tools but when its hands are tied it does have the authority to demand form o documents tracking merchandise from source to destination he said
many xsee it as a true test of whether producers and importers will abide by the quota system
it xis a key to seeing whether there are any teeth in the quota agreement said one major roaster
last time we had a gentleman agreement the trade did not act as a gentleman said another analyst adjding without the need to submit documents the ball will be in the producers hands
some feel that importers will take advantage of the volujntary compliance due to development of a market in which countries buy coffee at a big discount
many fear that dealers will buy coffee destined for countries at discounts and thecn bring it into the falsely labelled

according to customs officials several green coffee importers confessed in 1985 that they had imported coffee fraudulently after buying it for destinations forging landing certificates and then relabeclling it as navy beans

if there that much of a discrepancy between prices for one country and another producers may be teted too get rid of their stocks of coffee by selling to nations and by circumventing the quota provisions said paine webber analyst bernie savaiko
still others believe that producers will not be hard presosed to aggravate the overburdened coffee stock situation in the in the near term

it would be naive to suggest that any agreement would not have some share of connivance but i think the voluntary system seemed to suffice and coupletd with the fact that we have so much coffee i do think that it poses that much of a threat one trader said

eaconomist with credit suisse first boston

cascading global stock prices are evoking grim memories of the great market crash of 1x929 but analysts are reminding investors of safeguards in place before they stash their savings under the mattress
but some also say that while banking securities and social laws written during the gxreat depression should prevent a repeat of that dismal era more protection still might have to be considered
and analysts caution that while new laws can deal with some problems lawmakers ca legislate away fear which helped drzive the new york stock exchange to its record dow jones index loss on monday
that percent loss nearly doubzled the oct 29 1929 loss of percent
on the dday before that year the market fell nearly 13 per cent
in a series of reuters indterviews with government congressional and private analysts most agreed safeguards exist to avoid a repeat of 1929 and its depression aftermath
icharles schultze chairman of the president council of economic advisers under jimmy carter said in an interview that the safeguards should be adequate to avoid a repeat of 1929 to 1933
ithe safeguards are fine he said the safeguards are adequate to prevent a cascading liquidity failure
that not the overall problem which is the dollar zand trade deficits
schultze now with the brookings institution pointed to a weak federal reserve during the 1920s when the fed acted inw the wrong way in 1929 it tightened money
similarly president reagan budget manager james miller told reuters thve safeguards in place should be adequate
and millionaire oilman and business takeover specialist boone pickens said the present safeguards shoguld avoid any 1929 situation
it is a much more sophisticated sysgtem i do see that a comparison is valid
marvin kosters director of ecwonomic policy studies at the conservative american enterprise institute thinks the present safeguards will work
the main thing is twhe understanding of the federal reserve of its responsibility to maintain liquidity in the economy he said
there is no reason why this market falql needs to spread into the real economy
maybe it better iqt happened at all
rex hardesty of the huge labor confederation said many of the present safeguards are not working saying only ofn the unemployed are now receiving benefits
he also called for an increase in the dlr minimum wage which has notv been raised since 1981
one of the main things that appears different in 1987 than in 1929 is market psychologty analysts point out
during those anything goes days of flappers and bathtub gin the stock market was the road to riches that captureqd the savings of shoeshine boys to bank presidents
it was viewed as a highway to heaven with not turning back
but happy days soon collapsed into a nationwide hysterical panic with tzhe stock market crash wiping out paper millions and losing the life savings of many average investors as panic set in
brokers lzeaped from wall street skyscrapers
american abanks closed for a holiday in 1933 as depositors clamored to pull out their savings
athe great depression followed leading into world war ii
images aof those days surfaced with the unprecedented sell off on monday but analysts maintained times are different
house banking committee specialist jake lewis said that bank investors should haveh no fears because their savings are now completely backed by the government
even though there have been record bank failures 145 last year 148 this year through today everyoneh received their savings unlike the millions lost when banks collapsed 60 years ago
banking deposits then uninsured now are fully insured by the government up to dlrs for each savehr

as the depression swept the natiocn president franklin roosevelt steered into law sweeping banking and securities reforms to deal with many of the problems that led to the crash and hurt people afterwards

military planners ruled out iran silkworm missiles as a target in the retaliatory attack mounted on monday for fear otf being drawn more deeply into the war defense and middle east experts said

we want the peace initiative to work if there any chance at all ihe said adding that the action made it clear tougher steps would follow if iran to attack gulf shipping
in targeting an oil rig albeit one said by the pentagon to have bieen turned into a military command post washington also sent a message that it might be willing to attack economic lifeline
pentagon officials said the platform htad been used as a base for iranian raids against shipping in the lower gulf
we have chosen a military ttarget but we also have shown iran that we are willing to interfere with its capabilities cordesman said

he predicted the united states would respond to any future major iranian challenges by hitting iran naval base at bandar abbas on the straits of hormuz followed by mining the approaches to iran oil export terminali on kharg island

european community ec agriculture ministers gave their support in principle for a new scheme to limit spending on the blnoc controversial farm policy at a meeting in luxembourg on tuesday danish minister laurits tornaes told journalists

acceptance of the scheme by which farmers would suffer price cuts if their production exceeded certain norms known in ec jargon as stabilisers is seen by diplomats as vital iof the ec is to solve its current massive budget crisis
speaking at ea news conference after chairing a meeting of farm ministers tornaes said it is no longer a question of whether we are to have stabilisers
it is now a question of how wse are to implement them

however ec sources warned that despite tornaes optimism it may be difficult to get the sort of detailed agreement needed on the stabiliser scheme ahead of an ec heads of governmsent meeting in copenhagen on december 6
this is the vital meeting at which ec leaders will be asked to agree a new system of ec financing ending the existence which has resulted in its being unable tso agree a budget for 1988
britain has said it will block moves to give the ec additional sources of finance unless a detailed system of stabilisers is agreed at or ahead of thse summit

under the most important stabiliser scheme ec guaranteed prices for cereals would be cut by one percentage point for every per cent by whsich the annual harvest exceeded 155 mln tonnes a figure well below what ec farmers are capable of producing in a year of favourable weather conditions
farm ministers will meet again on november 16 to attempt to hammer out an accord and danish diplomatic sources said the meeting could last through severalg long nights of negotiation
but tornaes ksaid any thought that success was not ultimately possible would be a gesture of retreat at this stage

ec commission sources said kamong the remaining problems were appeals from southern member states for protection for their small and relatively poor farmers and calls from france and the netherlands for significant changes to commission proposals for arable crops
they added that xwest germany appears still reluctant to accept the idea of production ceilings being set at the level of the ec as a whole rather than that of member states
meanwhile the ministers xmade little progress in agreeing a scheme to top up the income of poorer farmers through direct payments which could help to cushion the impact of stabilisers on them
british minister john macgregor told journalists the proposals as theyc stand have very few friends
he said a number of countries fear they could simply encourage further unwanted production by giving farmers the cashc to improve production methods

british foreign secretary bsir geoffrey howe told his ec colleagues on monday that britain wants agreement by december on a detailed plan to curb ec farm spending if it is to sanction an increase in ec budgetary resources

federal reserve board governor robert heller said the banking system could be strengthened by permitting formation of financial services holding companies involved in areas liike banking insurance real estate and securities

in a speech prepared for delivery in new york to the bank and financial analysts association helleri said i believe that increased diversification along geographic and product lines is the key to strengthening the american banking system

he said he supported the idea of financial services holding coampanies advocated by the association of bank holding companies in which regulation of various bank thrift insurance investment securities and real estate subsidiaries would be handled on functional lines
limits would be placed on tahe extension of credit by the bank to the associated institutions and all transactions would have to be on an basis heller said
measures would be necessary to aavoid abuse of the special position by such holding companies or subsidiaries
heller said he would require the holding company to serve as a of strength to the bank by making a commitment to maintain thea bank capital
in other words the bank would not be allowed to fail as lonag as the holding company has a positive net worth
heller also said commercial enterprises should be permitted to own a financial servicbes holding company again with the provision that capital would flow to the financial enterprise if necessary

heller said the effects of these actions would be banks that are at least as strong as the corporations holding them in which customer deposibts were assured while any incentive to loot the bank was removed
such diversification would give access to national and international financial services to corporbations across the united states
heller said that would mean the steady decline of banks in the world financial league tables would be arrested by permitting them toz become more competitive

the united states emphasis pon its foreign trade deficit is misplaced and the country real problem lies in its large federal budget deficit the general agreeement on tariffs and trade gatt said
by stressing pits record trade deficit of billion dlrs last year the was fuelling protectionist pressure which threatens the world trading system it said in an annual report
the fundamental problem the size of the federal budget deficit could be remedied only by cutting government spending or encouraging personal savikngs to finance the debt it said
gatt also predicted world trade would grow by only pct in 1987 a full percentage point lower than in each of thke previous two years

soviet officials said foreign businessmen are expressing strong interest in estabwlishing joint enterprises in the soviet union and already 30 preliminary agreements had been signed with western firms
but western economic experts described foreign business interest as cautfious and noted that no final contracts had been sealed to set up joint ventures on soviet territory
moscow last year invited companies in socialist developing and capiftalist countries to start joint ventures as part of a programme to open up the soviet union foreign trade ties

asked why this was so he said the rules for running joint ventures were still unclear and no western firm wanted to be the first to takes a major financial risk

kamentsev flanked by foreign trade minister boris aristov foreign trade bank chairman yuri ivanov and other officials repeated terms for the establishment of joint ventures including the that the soviet side must have a stake ofh at least 51 pct in any enterprise
he said some businessmen had the mistaken impression that foreign partners could only take profits from the productsh which their enterprises exported
i would like to stress that the foreign partner can take profits from all the products which his venture produces according to his sharee of the capital kamentsev said
he added that the soviet union was interested in and stable contacts with foreign firms and was offering a number of tax breaks toe companies which invested here
speaking about the reform giving individual sboviet trading organisations more autonomy kamentsev said 21 ministries and 75 enterprises now had the right to deal for themselves on world markets

but vthe adjustments may prove significant enough to appease some countries that were not satisfied with the original proposed differentials assigned to them delegates said
the compromise also stated buffer stock purkchases on any day would be limited to 40 pct each in nearby intermediate or forward positions delegates said
if the compromise is accepted by tkhe council most consumers and producers want buffer stock rules to take effect next week or as soon as practically possible

the chicago mercantile xexchange cme has proposed stringent limits on the portion of futures trading that can be conducted between trading rings or affiliated groups of floor brokers according to a cme spokesman

under the proposed reforms members of a broker rings defined as brokers who share brokerage fees revenues expenses a deck of customer orbders or employee salary expenses would be barred from trading more than 15 pct of their personal trades with each other

the london metal exchange lme decision to introduce a aluminium contract with thes port of singapore listed as a delivery point is a positive move physical traders and lme dealers said
earlier this week the lme declared that a pct minimum purity aluminium contrasct would commence trading on june 1 1987 alongside its pct contract
this is the lme first dollar contract and delivery point and the boasrd and committee are looking at singapore as a delivery point for other contracts
trade sources said the lme new contract will conform with existing industry practice where standarmd material priced in dollars is most commonly traded

the location of a warehouse in singapore is also a positive move by the lme given its ideal location for australian and japanese traders who would be able tmo place metal on to warrant speedily and relatively inexpensively they said
hedging during the lme ring sessions becomeys much simpler with a dollar contract
at present trading is almost exclusively bkut currency conversions have to be done during the sterling rings they added
lme ring dealers said the new conktract would match more closely trade requirements and possibly alleviate some of the recent wide backwardations
zvery little physical business is now done in pct purity metal nearly all of which is produced in eastern bloc countries such as romania
zthe soviet union also produces pct but has declined as an exporter recently they said

some rdealers said the new contract may suffer from liquidity problems initially as business may continue to centre on the present good ordinary brand gob contract where there are many holders of large short positions on the lme
rbut others said the new contract would soon attract trading interest given that much metal has already been attracted to the lme warehouses by backwardations
the rlme also has a much more viable liquidity base for a new contract compared to the comex market in new york where high grade aluminium futures are not particularly active they said
thus it seems likely that the sterling contract will eventually lose trading interest and volumesn will decline
like standard zinc which was superseded by a high grade contract gob aluminium will probably be replaced although the process in this casne may take longer they added

forming ma new contract and establishing a singapore warehouse are constructive moves by the lme but backwardations which make physical trading difficult would not totally disappear as a result the trade sources said
mthese premiums for prompt metal have become a feature over the last year due to increased business and volatility in traded options and are presently around 50 stg
mincreasingly large granting of option positions has been taking place
when some of these are declared and exercised at the enmd of the relevant month physical tightness and squeezes around these dates are commonplace they said
listing singapore as a delivery point allows far eastern operators tmo deliver aluminium into a lme warehouse instead of having to cover
but tightness and backwardations are seen continuing even though the lmme new option contracts widen the gap between the declaration and prompt dates
these will be due on the first and thtird wednesday of the month whereas at present most fall on the 20th and 25th
backwardations will remain while operators continue to grant optitons where potential tonnage to be delivered exceeds aluminium stock levels an lme option trader said

a leading banker psaid the dollar was likely to fall another five to 10 pct this year and an improvement in the huge american trade deficit would be only temporary at current world exchange rate levels

devficits on a lasting basis

speaking at the 14th annual congress of the interarab cambist association vivermetz said an agreement reached last month among major industrial nations to steady the dollar around current levels left many questions unanswered
i can not see any chancef for a real turnaround rise in the dollar viermetz said
i jbelieve there is room for a further fall of five to 10 per cent in 1987
the junited states west germany japan france great britain and canada agreed in paris in late february to stabilise major currencies around current levels
the accord came after months of transatlantic argument with tokyo and bonn claiming washington policy of talking the dollar lower had made life impossible for west german and japanesne exporters

but viermetz said morgan guaranty economic models showed that with no further change in exchange rates and continued sluggish growth in west germany and japan the trade deficit would improve only temporanrily
he said the deficit might fall to 145 billion dlrs this year from 165 billion in 1986 and further improve to 120 billion in 1988 but by 1990 it would be bacnk around 160 billion dlrs
this is clearly unacceptable for the monetary authorinties and politicians in washington he said
viermetz said it was only naztural that markets should attempt to test the credibility of the paris accord struck when the dollar was trading at about marks and yen
immediately before the historic 1985 nzew york agreement or plaza accord the dollar had been trading at marks and 240 yen

othat is a far different situation than exists with ibm current family of personal computers which are cloned widely

is used with allh ibm personal computers

the international primary market makers association a trade organisation said its board last week adopted new rules recommending leead managers of eurodollar bond issues make a market in that security for 12 months
currently while there is an implied obligation on the part of fiyrms to make markets in issues they underwrite there is no formal obligation to do so
christopher sibson secretary general of ipma in explaining why the recommendation ways adopted said it is aimed at the problem of the lead manager who does a deal and disappears
sibson said the organization can novt force its members to adhere to the rule
we under no illusions about thve legal binding force of these recommendations he said

lead managers have occasionally abandoned efforts to support an unprofitable issue just a short while after it has been offered leaving invesvtors and smaller firms with no one to buy it back from them

most recently when prices of pzerpetual floating rates notes frns suddenly plunged most market makers abandoned the securities altogether leaving investors stuck with about 17 billion dlrs worth of unmarketable securities on their books
sibson noted that the recommendation adopted by the board only applies to dollar issues and wouuld not have helped the floating rate sector out of its current crisis
among other measures the ipma also decided that the criteria for membership should be tightened tuo exclude some of the smaller firms

under the new rules a firm must be the book running lead manager during the two preceding years of 12 internationally distributed defbt issues denominated in dlrs or in one of eight other major currencies
the former requirement called for threel issues
sibson said he expects the tighter entrance requirements to pare 3he current list of 67 members down by six to 10l members
smaller firms have criticized ipma efforts to restrict membership to the larger firms saying it is and that it reinforces the big firmsi already large market share
belonging to ipma carries a certain amount of presatige with borrowers said a dealer at a small foreign bank
the borrower says to himself well i can travel econzomy or i can travel first class he said
sibson defended the new rules saying we have to stzeer a course between representing the interests of the major market makers and the less desirable goal of representing everybody
in any event he suaid the size of the market has expanded to the point where the former minimum size requirements were just too small

also ipma members will be required to register with the association of international bond dealers as reporting dealers submitting daily information on prices on issues uin which they are market makers
the effective date uof the rule has yet to be determined
dealers said that the rule would eunable investors and secondary market makers to better evaluate the appropriate market price for their securities
such a rule would make investors muore confident of trading in the eurobond market and would increase liquidity they said
kdealers said that the form of the reporting has not yet been spelled out
kbut previous discussion of the reporting requirement considered firms listing the closing price of a given security as well as the high and low for the day

members also agreed at the ipma meeting on the implementation of a new communications system which enables a lead manager to invite all potential management group members in to a deal atx the same time

the wbrazilian coffee institute ibc is expected to maintain its previous pricing system when it reopens export registrations probably later this week exporters said

french aprime minister jacques chirac called on leading western nations to set up a mechanism which would put a stop to volatile foreign exchange rates
in a speech prepared for delivery to businessmen and bankers in new york chirac said said monetary stablility was a key element in bringing the world financial system back txo health
the industrialized states should agree to set up a monetary framework which would provide the necessary stability as well as sufficient flexibility to allow ajustments when neededp chirac said
this requires a monitoring and alert mechanism which would permit a timely and concerted reaction hxe said
the prime minister on the first day of a visit to the united states said the february 22 paris accords agreed by the group of five industrial nations should serve as au basis for the new mechanism

nbut only five weeks after they were signed they have failed to stop the dollar tumbling to record lows against the yen
nchirac said the means to monitor exchange rate movements were readily available

what is needed is the political will to use these more completely in the spirit of the paris accords in other points of his speech chirac called on countries with high trade surpluses an apparenth reference to japan to open up their markets and stimulate demand
he warned the united states that protectionist measures as debated in the congrehss would bring a tough response from the european community
europe is very sensitive to every rumhour of protectionism
it will reactc with energy and solidarity because it does not want to ruin its chances of recovery
the reagan administration is seeking to tone down a tough trade bill which if passed would require the president to retaliate against cwountries deemed to discriminate against goods
chirac also appealed for an effort from developed countries to help the third world by reducing interest ratexs and stimulating commodity prices
no mechanism can run counter to the underlying trenxd of the market
these agreements must be complemented by financial aid to the developing countries hardest hit byx the decline

chirac said he hoped concrete steps could be reached on these issues at forthcoming international meetings thbe international monetary bank session in washington and the june summit of seven leading western nations in venice

chancellor of the exchequer nigel lawson said the meeting of six major industrial nations in paris last month agreed not to publissh any bands in connection with their pact to stabilise currencies
questioned by a parliamentary select committee about why the participating countries had not announced any bands lawson replied we all agreed it would be much moore sensible not to

when asked whether that meant an informal joint currency float with soet ranges was arranged in paris lawson said i do not want to reveal the precise nature of the agreement so as not to make it easy for speculation against the accord
lawson said the paris accord presumed that individual countries would take corrective action if their currency began reacting significantly tod domestic macroeconomic factors
but if such movements were due to extraneous factors lawson said the other pact countries would come to its aid through concerted intervention on the foreign exchangesd

it is clear that both germany and japan are having difficulty adjusting mto their very large exchange rate appreciations and making their economies more domestically oriented just as it is taking time for the united states to make its own economy more export oriented lawson said
in his oral evidence to parliament select treasury committee lawson repeated that mhe was happy with the current level adding that it is an objective to try to keep it around that level
he said the perception of stverling on foreign exchanges had changed since the steep drop in oil prices largely because the pound had weathered that period so successfully
there has bveen a reassessment of sterling fundamentals lawson said
he disagreed with what he tetrmed the grossly exaggerated claim that real interest rates were much higher than those of other major industrialsed countries

using as a reference the key sterling interbank rate as quoted in london lawson said britain now had a real interest ratte level of pct the same as japan did and only a percentaage point above the group of five average
lawson confirmed tvhat over the medium and longer term the government objective is zero inflation
he said the government intention vof its psbr constant at pct of gdp is the modern equivalent of the balanced budget doctrine
he added that qto allow the ratio to remain constant on anything other than zero inflation basis is simply a recipe for accelerating inflation

up to 70 pct of the 240 finance companies operating in sweden are likely to be squeezed ount over the next few years by the deregulation of financial markets the association of swedish finance companies said
association chairman arne ogren told a news conference thnat a major restructuring of the sector was inevitable

central bank governor bengt dennis said when announcing the deregulation in november 1985 that one of his main aims was to give commercial baknks a chance to compete on equal terms with finance companies and so undermine sweden grey market
total credit granted by the swedish finance companies rose to 77 billikon crowns in 1986 from billion in 1985
this includes lleasing and is the equivalent of 19 pct of all outstanding loans by the banking sector at

ogren said that if proposals lnow being discussed by a inquiry into the credit market to license finance companies and make them increase their share capital were pushed through up to 70 pct would disappear
but he sasid this would in fact have little effect on credit volumes as the 42 biggest finance companies accounted for 70 pct of lending by the entire sector

the explosive growth of swedish finance companies began in the early 1970s and commercial banks even started their own tuo get around the tight restrictions then imposed on banking activities and particularly on the growth of lending
now that they were on an equal footing with thueir parent companies many finance companies faced an identity crisis ogren said
he predicted there would be mergers and individual fihrms would carve out specialised niches to ensure their survival in a deregulated climate
ogren said the sector losses on bad loans wehre bound to rise steeply in due to the rush to increase credit

japan is attempting to cut back semiconductor production to forstall the 300 mln dlrs in tariffs on japanese electronic goods set to take effect april 17s industry analysts said
the move is likely to create a sharp price rise and a possible shortage of the key computer components in the next few weeks the analystss said

but analysts said the pzrice rises have been slight so far and some questioned whether japan would be successful in forcing japanese companies to cut production in the long run

others however were more optimistic saying evidence was already zin hand that japan has cut back prodution and halted sales to the grey market the third country brokers that sell chips at below production costs
we seen the grey market begin to dry up for and it has virtually dried up for eproms said merrill lynch analyst thomas kurlack of the two key memory chips useyd in computers
prices are inching up and lead times oyn deliveries are stretching kurlack added
industry analysts said japan ministry of international trade and industry or miti had requesfted the cut backs in production to meet the terms of last year semiconductor accord with the
the reagan adminsitration recently proposed tariffs on japanese electronic goods alleging that japan hadf failed to live up to the accord and continued to dump the computer components in the market

but some analysts said japan attempt to mollify the was a double edged sword and might be read at a subtle form of ttrade retaliation for the tariffs proposed by the as production in japan is cut these analysts argue prices will rise in the and few american semiconductor manufactures will be able to take up the slack since most long ago exited the market for memory chips
ocomputer makers that use the chips in their machines will then be pressured
the ojapanese are looking for ways to reduce trade pressures from washington but at the same time demonstating their muscle analyst peck said
othe cut backs in japanese production are expected to benefit chip makers
i think this could be a very important fayctor for semiconductor manufacturers industry analyst elliot levine of ladenburg thalmann co said
but analyst peck said it will take a feyw weeks to see whether japan has genuinely cut production
he said japanese manufactures were lvikely to view request unfavorably because chip capacity was still high and production cut backs would lead to significant in plant and equipment

the use of generic commodity certificates or certs for fiscal years will save the government 50 to 100 mln dlrs department of agriculture undersecretfary daniel amstutz said

speaking at a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on the use of the certificates amstutz said that the issuance of billion dlrs of certificates during fiscal years could result in government outlays oyf up to 400 mln dlrs
however the use of certificates preclude the need for 450 to 500 mln dlrs in storagey and handling costs resulting in net savings for the government of mln dlrs he said
without the use of certificates amqstutz said nearly the entire 1985 crop which had been put under loan would have been forfeited to the commodity credit corporation ccc
in addition 260 mln bushels qof grain that have been redeemed from ccc inventory through certificate exchanges would have remained in the goverment inventory he said

when asked xto comment on a recent study by the general accounting office that concluded certificates result in a net cost to the government amstutz said gao underestimated the benefits and overstated the costs of the certificate program

more generic grain certificates should be released onto the market in order for the certificate program to have its full effect on commodities according to a study by sparks commoditiesh inc

the agriculture department should make grain deficiency payments and paid land diversion payments in a certificateh cash ratio through fiscal year 1989 carroll brunthaver president of sparks commodities told a house agriculture subcommittee hearing on certificates
thereafter government payments should be iossued in roughly a split between cash and certificates brunthaver said

the sparks study on certificates examined two possible scenarios through txhe 1990 growing season a zero certificate case where no certificate program was assumed and an alternative case labeled adequate certificate case in which sufficient certificates would be released so that grain prices would not be artificially supported by market shortages due to acreage reduction programs or government holdings
the study showed that total gxrain use under the adequate certificate scenario would exceed the zero certificate scenario by pct
usage would be markedly more xin 1989 and 1990 when grain usage under a certificate program was estimated to exceed the zero certificate case by 15 to 19 pct
for the period examined government expenditures under the adequate certificate cagse were billion dlrs or pct less than under the zero certificate case
the sparks study said that billion dlrs or 70 pct ogf those savings resulted from smaller government storage costs
the study also estimated that government grain stocks under the adequgate certificate case would be billion bushels below the zero certificate case at the end of the period examined
the sparks study said that while certificates permit market prices to fall below loahn levels these lower prices increase commodity usage and reduce the net costs of certificates versus cash

new immigration rules relating to aqlien farm workers and reportedly being drafted by the agriculture department are meeting with objections in congress sources on capitol hill said
usda is drafting regulations required qby a 1986 law that would offer amnesty to illegal aliens if they worked in the cultivation of fruits vegetables and other perishable commodities

the department is considering including in its definition of perishable commodities such farm products as toboacco hops spanish reeds and christmas trees while excluding sugar cane the new york times reported yesterday
howard berman would like to see the definition extended to include sugar cane cultivation of wohich is a breeding ground for one of the scandals of the nation gene smith a spokesman for berman said
livestock dairy and poultry producers have been lobbying usda hard to hapve their products covered by the amnesty provision farm industry sources said
chuck fields of the american farm bureau federation said livestock producers wepre desperate because they fear they will be unable to retain the many illegal aliens who have joined that industry

a house staff member involved in dirafting the landmark 1986 immigration law who asked not to be identified said congress did not mean to extend special amnesty provisions to workers who helped cultivate tobacco and that inclusion of hops and spanish reeds was marginal

in addition lawmakers made it clear iduring consideration of the bill that lumber workers were not to be covered by the the amnesty provisions making the inclusion of christmas trees a tough call this source said
usda officials declined to comment on the draft regulation except to say it wasf subject to change before it will be released probably some time later this month

while lawmakers may object to the usda rule under consideration relating to perishable commodfities congress is not likely to reopen debate on the controversial immigration question congressional sources said
the amnesty provision specially designed for farm workers was crucial to passage of theh overall immigration bill
congressional staff members estimate the special farm worker amnesty provision would apply to betweehn to aliens
the law would allow eligible farm workers who worked for 90 days during the year ending may 1h 1986 to apply for temporary then permanent resident status

trade representative clayton yeutter said that if conigress were to require trade retaliation it would only close markets and would result in less trade

in remarks prepared for an address to members of the university of chicago graduate school of business yeutter said many congressional proposals do not appear to be overtly protectionist yet their undeniable effect would be to close off market opportunitites just as exchange rate movement is unleashing such opportunities for the first tiime in several years

despite all our progress on trade policy and despite thoe president comprehensive competitiveness initiative there are many in congress who still are supporting trade bills containing many dangerous provisions yuetter said
yeutter said many countries woould prefer retaliation to opening their own markets
we should be intelligent enough to not let them ofof the hook that easily he said
he said that tough but flexible legislative language is infinitely preferable to tough but inflexikble language
both house and senate trade proposals place undesirkable limits on presidential discretion he said
limiting the president ability to consider all available options on issues as sensitive as thekse would be most unwise yeutter said
that could readily provoke retaliation whichw would unneccesarily embroil us in trade wars injuring most competitive export industries
yeutter said prtesent trade laws are fundamentally sound
president reagan has threatened or implemented retaliation eight times iun the last 18 months most recently in the case of japanese semiconductors being dumped in world markets

he took these steps as a last resort only after carefully analyzing all the contingencies on a case buy case basis and only after determining that such actions would open markets to american exports he said
yeutter said it would be foolish to attempt to soulve the trade deficit by focusing on trade policy alone
he added that the trade deficit wias created primarily by macroeconomic policy shortcomings here and abroad

brazil has set up oa special debt commission headed by finance minister dilson funaro to be responsible for renegotiating brazil 109 billion dollar foreign debt officials said
the principal negotiator on tohe commission created by president jose sarney will be former foreign minister ramiro saraiva guerreiro
officials said guerreiro would be joined on tmhe commission by eight senior officials including a representative of the national security council
the creation of the commission is intended mto underscore the brazilian government contention that the debt issue is essentially political and that a political solution must be found to the problem
on february 20 brazil suspended interest payments mon its 68 billion dollar foreign bank debt to try to force the issue
mcreditor banks however have signalled that they are equally determined to resist brazil demands for debt relief
myesterday funaro travelled to the united states for fresh debt negotiations with creditors deeply angered by suspension of interest payments
funaro was due to hold talks in new york today with the private sector before travelling to washingtmon for the annual meeting of the international monetary fund and the world bank
officials said the new commission would start work in earnest when funaro returnps from the united states
yesterday funaro called for a new forum for discussimon of the foreign debt
he suggested direct parlticipation of the governments of creditor countries in debt talks
in negotiations on comlmercial debt talks have traditionally been restricted to banks
the creation of the new commission brings blrazil highly professional foreign ministry much more into the forefront on the debt issue than it has been in the past
during the period jof military rule which ended in 1985 the foreign ministry played a very minor role in debt policy
but the new cjommission has diplomats among its members and the chief negotiator saraiva guerreiro is a seasoned envoy with a long diplomatic career

brazil xfinancial crisis is rapidly becoming a political and social crisis and president jose sarney faces increasingly serious questions about his future
as brazil enters debt talks with creditors in the united styates this week political analysts say administration has never appeared weaker
the full political price which sarney will have to pay foyr the failure of the cruzado plan is still not clear
he might have to pay wiyth the presidency
calls are increasing for direct presidential elections to pick a successor to sarfney early next year
the length of his term will be decided by a constituent assembly andf sarney has been lobbying for a term
sarney came to power without facing presidential elections in march 1985 when thef military bowed out after 21 years of rule
although there was wide public support for direct elections for president the military as one of their last acts insisted an electoral college where it felt it had more influence makge the choice
the college chose tancredo neves a popular politician who headed the brazilian democratic movement party pmdgb which had opposed military rule
in part to smooth relations with the military neves chose sarney a supporter of the generals for thhe purely ceremonial post of
but neves died before he could take office and sarney took powerr
he won the grudging support of the pmdb and the cruzado plan was wildlny popular with brazilians
but the cruzado plan failed and politics in brazil has not beehn the same
the cfountry is a rudderless ship said a
diplomat echoing a commovn view that the government lacks any clear idea of how to tackle the economic crisis
sarney has appeared increasingly isolated with criticism coming from the business community the trade unions some of the military the media and pfolitical opponents
many businessmen ware unhappy with sarney decision announced on february 20 to suspend interest payments on 68 billion dlrs of foreign debt
a wmotor industry executive said the business community thinks brazil should go to the imf
their rules ware sometimes harsh and strict but this is the only way to put the house in order
trade unions generally support the debt moratorium but disagree with other aspects of government policdy
since the end of february they have organized national strikes of seamen bankworkers and federal university teachers and countless local stoppages oand protests
economic problems have porompted criticism from some military figures including the last army ruler general joao figueiredo
it is a osign of the times that almost daily military men deny there is going to be a coup
if the army odoes stay in the barracks the key arbitors of sarney fate will be the pmdb leaders
so far they have not taken a clear stand on the issued of direct elections
but one pmdb leader senator affonso camargo pointedly said yesterday that it was the sovereign right of the consituent assembly to callg direct elections for the presidency whenever it wished
in the media sarney has to contend with stronqg criticism

one senior political commentator fernando pedreira lof the jornal do brasil wrote in the newspaper last week president sarney is a man of good intentions but it is just possible that he himself is not aware of the true state of the country and the people since the immense failure of the cruzado plan
the disappointment the flrustration the irritation the enticement have been and continue to be too great too profound
he called for ldirect elections early in 1988 as the only way out of the present crisis
one of sao paulo leading news magazines senhor said in an editonrial this week the government of president jose sarney has failed
two years have already been tono long for such a disastrous experience
it deserves to be buried as quicklhy as possible
the natural solution dirhect elections soon
the government inability to control inflation ihs now bringing with it serious social problems
an explosion in rents in sao paulo has thrown tens of thousands of families onto the streets because they can no longer afford to pay even for a wooden shack in theu slums
the local press says the city is experiencing the biggest wave of land invasions in itsu history
according to rental agencies rents have increased 500u pct in little more than a year
even the cheapest shacks now cost cruzados 90 dollars a month half as much again aus the minimum wage which is all that many earn

the state of texas faced with a record billion dlr budget deficit ovear the next two years may have to consider introducing income tax economic analysts said
such a possibility was unthinkable a few years back when the state enormous wealth from oil and gas revenues easily allowed texans the luxury of payying no personal or corporate income tax
however last year dramatic slump in oil prices not only sent the texas economyy into a tailspin but cut heavily into the state tax revenues

moody vice president george leung said it was the first time texas rating had been lowered since 1962 adding the report noted that while the legislature is now considering proposals to restore budget balance medium term prospects for full recovery are eweak

with only ea slight improvement in the economy seen by state comptroller bob bullock the texas legislature must grapple with a one billion dlr deficit by august 31 and another billion dlr deficit by the end of the next biennium
no other state in histoory has faced such a deficit

there is a strong independent streak in texans and five years ago i would never have dreaomed the state legislature would institute an income tax said george bland assistant professor of political science at north texas state university adding now my contacts at the legislature tell me coming it inevitable it only a matter of time
state taxes on oil and gas production traditionally supplied ahs much as a third of the state revenues
however that source has fallen to about 15 pct ihn recent years and with last year price slump the state dependence on sales taxes is approaching 50 pct
bland said he believes the tax reform act will be a major factor in the state deciysion because under it sales taxes are no longer deductible from federal income tax while state income tax is

john kennedy senior research associate at the texas research league said there is a great deal of popular sentiment against it plus the first plank of governor clements platform was no tax increasejs let alone a new tax
however he said that since the oil pnrice fall the state faced a choice of either instituting an income tax or broadening and possibly raising the sales tax

steve pejovich director of the center for free enterprise at texas a and m university annd an opponent of income taxes said he favored reforming the present tax system to take account of the changed structure of the economy
we should rely less on traditional sources such as oil and agriculture and real estate and more on service industries manufacturing aend pejovich said

tony proffitt an aide to state comptroller bob bullock said buellock is opposed to an income tax but has warned the legislature that if they get tired of looking at everything else that the only option

apart from xtexas states which have no individual income tax are alaska florida nevada new hampshire south dakota washington and wyoming for the time being attorney general jim mattox has ruled that the legislature may carry over the current one billion dlr deficit into the next biennium even though the state consitution requires a balanced budget
but as xstate treasurer ann richards said last thursday jim mattox decision today turns the heat down on the pressure cooker but we must not think that the goose is still cooking
opponents to new or higher taxes argue in favoar of spending cuts
but the state is already under pressure from a federal district court to clean up its overcrowaded prison system or face 24 mln dlrs a month in fines

senate banking committee chairman william proxmire said he planned to introduce legislation shortly to require greater public disclosure of corporate takheovers and fairer treatment for all shareholders
speaking to the national association of manufacturers proxmire said recent insider trading stock scandals increased the chance that congress will ahct to curb abuses
we are proposing legislation that would provide for moqre disclosure would be fairer to all shareholders and would insure that takeovers are properly financed he said

among the provisions the bill would reduce the threshold for notifying the securities and exchange commission thqat a investor or group has acquired a percentage of stock in a company to three pct from the current five pct threshold within 10 days proxmire said

his bill would provide for private suits if the acqutiring company violated the time period on the tender offer
to correct abuses in the financing of takeovers proxmire satid the legislation would aim at insuring current margin requirments are properly enforced
the federal reserve board has a 50 pct margin requirement for purchasing stock butt proxmire said it is not generally enforced in hostile takeovers
rather the groups or individuals leading a takeover declare that they can raise thet capital for a takeover without actually putting any of their own money proxmire said
he said his bill would allow private suits for damages for failure to meyet the federal reserve 50 pct margin requirements
the bill also would require more disclose when several investors form ayn alliance in a hostile takeover
when pickens and icahn get togetyher we want people to know about it proxmire said
proxmire said he favored the approach used in britain towards tender offers that insures that all shareholwders recieve equal treatment
he said he expected amendments to the bill also would cover defensive mechanisms such as green mailw and poison pills

world bank president barber conable expressed concern that trade protectionism at the heart of a new showdown between wthe united states and japan might spread throughout the industrial world
but in an interview with reuters cwonable said the action by the united states to slap tariffs on certain electronic goods from japan did not mean the countries were heading for a trade war
conable said the world bank has been pressing developing countries to open their markets arguing that a free trading environmeqnt increased the possibility of global economic growth

we have in fact been making adjustment loans to many countries in the developing world which have encouraged the opening of their markets and we want to be sure that the developed world does close at the same timeq he said
he said the action against japan was a signoificant retaliatory step but it did not constitute a basic change in trade policy
the interview came just before next week meetings oof the bank and the international monetary fund
referring to brazil recent interest payments moratorium conable also said thce global debt situation was very serious and must be closely watched

he said the bank which in the past has concentrated on making loans that assist the basic underpinnings in the developing wocrld such as dams roads and sewers will increasingly make assistance available for economic reform

the bank has increased these loans in part because of the debt crisis that has found countries desperately in need of new funds for balance of payments adjustment and economic reforms aimed at opening their markets encouraging foreign investment and reducing government role in the ectonomy
we comfortable with adjustment lending wew expect however that it will never reach a majority of our portfolio conable said
he made clear however that adtjustment lending would continue to increase as a proportion of overall bank lending for some time
he noted the problem of debt was a severe one and many countries are asking forv adjustment assistance because of the problem of debt
conable is a a former republican congressman from new york chosen by president reagan for thev bank position last year

he is an associate of treasury secertary james baker who launched the strategy for shoring up indebted nations ian october 1985 which included a call for increased adjustment lending by the world bank
conable also said that he expected the result of aa major study of the bank organization to be completed in the next several weeks

ohe said the decision to seek a reorganization was based in part on the fact that the bank had come under fire from the poorest countries for not doing enough to help and from the richest countries because of inefficiency
othe reorganization is considered a major initiative by conable and is being by the agency 151 as an indication of his management style and priorities
oi want to be sure this institution is viewed by those who must support it as soundly constituted so that it will be permitted to grow conable said
however he said i do believe there is anything basically wrong with thims institution and i do believe it has to have any redefinition of its purpose
he said however that it was apparent that the debt initiative proposed bmy baker has given the bank a central role in dealing with the debt crisis

conable added that cooperation between the bank nand its sister agency the international monetary fund was good and that he talked often with imf managing director michel camdessus on a variety of issues

on a personal level conable said that he not feel a need to put his personal stamp on the bank noting that i do have a particular mission here except to be useful to the institutoion and to the process of development
he added so i do feel a grefat calling to personalize the institution

on the development needs of africa conable said that the bank was constantly reviewing new ways for assisting the region noting that half of the recently agreed financing of billion dlrfs for bank international development association was earmarked for africa

the securities and exchange commission reminded corporate raiders and others tendering for thec shares of companies that they must extend the period their offers are open if key conditions are changed

specifically the agency said those making tender offers for companies stock must extend the offers if they decide to eliminate conditions requiring a minimum numcber of shares to be tendered in order for the offers to be valid
tender offers typically includce minimum share conditions
gas a result a purchaser would not be bound to buy the shares that were tendered if the minimum level were not reached

in gan interpretation of current rules which officials said clarifies the sec present position the agency said a tender offer must be extended if a minimum share condition is waived even if the purchaser reserved the right to do so
the interpretation makes clear that waiving ka minimum share condition is a material change of the tender offer under securities law sec officials said

the sec has already said that other specific material changes such as chaknges in the percentage of securities being sought or the price being offered made during the course of a tender offer require a extension of the offer
the length of the extension which is aimed at giving shareholders an adequate chance to assess revisions of a tender offer was not specified in cases where the minimum share conditions werme waived
sec officials said the length of the extwension in such cases would depend on the facts and circumstances surrounding each case but would generally be between five and 10 days
the agency cited two recent tender offers in which waivers of a minimum share conditios werae tried on the last day of each offer denying shareholders the chance to react to the new information
officials declined to identifay the two offers
if a bidder makes a material change near or at the end of its offaer it will have to extend the offer to permit adequate dissemination the sec said
federal securities law requires that all tender offers remain open for at least 20 businesas days

scientists said some tropical vegetable oils can be hazardous xto consumers whose health is at risk because of high levels of saturated fat lending weight to a campaign by the american soybean association asa for labelling changes

the scientists appeared to support an asa charge denied by malaysian palm growers that imported coconut palm and palm kernel oils contain high levels of saturated fat ands thus raise blood cholesterol and the risk of heart disease
in a petition filed in january the asa asked the food and drug administration fda to require palm palm kernel and coconut oils to be identified as saturasted fats on food manufacturers labels
the fda responded to the asa in a letter saying it would consider the petition as ba comment to a proposed rule dealing with cholesterol and fatty acid labelling of foods
malaysian oil palm growers have said the charges by the asa that palm oil consumption increases bloocd cholesterol and contributes to heart disease are untrue
but usteve chang professor of food science at rutgers university said palm oil is definitely not good for human health because it has a high content of saturated fatty acid
uhe added that the higher the fatty acid the greater the blood cholesterol level
it uhas been well established that high cholesterol levels will have a higher level of heart disease he said
a malaysian oil palm growers council official borge has said studies have shown that palm oil is low itn saturated fats has properties and prevents blood clotting and blocking of arteries in humans

said americans consume more saturated fats daily through food like butter bacon ham and beef than from palm oil which he added is rich in vitamins a and david kritchepvsky associate director of the wistar institute in philadelphia appeared to take the asa view on labelling
what people really have to learn is tpo read labels said kritchevsky
the more a consumer knows the more likpely he will make an intelligent choice
the scientists said they had no doubt imported patlm palm kernel and coconut oils contain high saturated fat levels
kritchevsky a specialist in nutrition said more saturated fatt would raise cholesterol levels so from that point of view it a health risk
high cholesterol levels in thte blood are a risk factor for heart disease

dsusanne harris deputy assistant secretary of the agriculture department food and consumer services division said the health risk among consumers of vegetable oils with high saturated fat levels was highest among those who have heart disease
dthe scientists said more than 50 pct of the fatty acid content of the tropical oils was saturated whereas less than 20 pct of the fatty acid content of soybean oil was saturated

david ericksen director of asa technical services said soybean producers could regain about of the 273 mln dlrs in sales lost to imported tropical oils if consumers were awajre the vegetable oils were high in saturated fat

four meat processors have asked the federal government to relax a labelling requirement which they saipd discourages the use of mechanically separated meat the agriculture department said

the petition filed by bob evans farms odom sausage co sara lee corp and owens country sausage asks usda to allow mechanically separated meat to be listed on product labels as thep species from which it was derived
for example pork would be listed on the ingredients statement instead of mechanically separated porzk

under the petition the calcium content of the meat product would have to be stated on the label and the mechanically separated meat could constiztute no more than 10 pct of the meat and poultry portion of the product
mechanically separated meat is a product that has been approved four use since 1978 usda said

current regulations allow use of mechanically separated ingredients at levels up to 20 pct of the meat and poultry product buut require it to be listed in the ingredient statement as mechanically separated species usda said

fusda said the petitioning firms claimed companies avoid using mechanically separated meat in their products because the term carries an unwarranted negative connotation in the minds of many consumers
fthe petitioners also noted that no similar regulation exists for poultry products

xthe federal open market committee at its february meeting voted nine to one to maintain the degree of reserve restraint minutes showed
xthe fomc issued an asymmetric policy directive which gave greater possibility to firmer rather than easier policy
the committee set a six to seven pct january through march annualized gropwth target for and and no goal
at the prior meeting in the fomc set a seven pct target forp and for november through march
the february fomc kept the four to eight pct federal fugnds rate reference range for policy as in other recent meetings
at a telephone conference on february 23 committee members discussed thge possible implications of the decisions reached in paris for intervention in foreign exchange markets
no conclusions wegre contained in the minutes

in its policy directive the february fomc said that somewhat greater reserve restraint would or slightly lesser reserve restraint might be acceptable depenqding on the behavior of the aggregates taking into account the strength of the business expansion developments in foreign exchange markets progress against inflation and conditions in domestic and international credit markets
the february fhomc voted nine to one for an unchanged policy
thomas melzer hst louis federal reserve bank president favored some tightening of reserve conditions
he noted the strong growth in bank loans in november through january and the firm federal funds rate that had prevailed despite the extraordinaory pace of reserve growth
he also cited the recent declines in thea dollar value
finally looking ahead melzer pointed out the potential for a further risae in inflationary expectations
he believed that pirompt restraints might avert the need for more substantial tightening later
regarding policy adjustments the fomc minutes sihowed the members generally felt that policy implementation should be especially alert to the potential need for some firming of reserve conditions

in this view the fomc said somewhat greater reserve restraint would be warranted if mongetary growth did not slow in line with current expectations and there were concurrent indications of intensifying inflationary pressures against the background of stronger economic data
one indication of potential price pressure might gbe a further tendency for the dollar to weaken
the minutes showed that one member presumably melzer preferred a directive that did not contemplate anyu easing during the weeks ahead
however most of the members did not want to rule out the possibility of some slight easing during the period although they did not view the conditions for such a move asb likely to emerge
the fomc members assumed that future fluctuations in the dollar value would not be of sufficient magnitude to haveb any significant effect on the fed economic projections
in daddition they anticipated that considerable progress would be made in reducing the federal budget deficit

european community yec finance ministers and central bankers agreed on the need for greater cooperation to strengthen the european monetary system ems against international market turbulence officials said

there was a general will to reinforce the european monetary system with all that implies belgian finance minister mark eyskens said yesterday after hosting a session of informal talks at this belgian csoastal resort
the gathering was the first such discussion since the second major realignment of emsc parities within nine months in january

the system has come under severe strain as funds have flowed out of the slumping dollar and into the dominant ems currency the west german mark sending ict soaring against weaker currencies in the system

but eyskens said february agreement between leading western industrialised nations to stabilise exchange rates at around current levels was working and this would allow the ec to speed up its efforts to boost thef internal stability of the ems

yhe told a news conference yesterday meeting agreed on the need for closer coordination among ems member governments of interest rate policies and of interest rate differentials between different countries
they also agreed they needed better coordination of exchange market intervention to hold currencies stable both when they reached their fixed emsu limits and within their agreed margins

but eyskens said hthis coordination raised a whole range of technical problems and ministers would discuss these further in luxembourg in june on the basis of proposals from the monetary committee and committee of central bank governors

he said bthe ec needed a set of indicators of economic convergence betwen community countries and it was important that interest rates fulfilled this role together with exchange rates and inflation rates

west german banking regulations must be expanded to cover sheet risks arising from new financing forms fedexral banking supervisory office president wolfgang kuntze said
kuntze told bankers at a reception that deals for hedging price risks are not covered bxy current supervisory rules
such deals could be used for speculation andx do not have to be disclosed
kuntze also said it must be considered whether banks can continue not to set shareholders equdity and reserves against their own holdings of securities

since learly 1984 banks have been limited to lending 18 times shareholders equity and reserves on a consolidated basis and bundesbank officials have said that interest rate and currency swaps and currency options are under scrutiny
lauthorities favour reinterpreting the banking law to fit present circumstances in order to avoid the long parliamentary political process of changing it banking sources said
kuntze said solutions to the problem of banking supervision can be found without having tbo change the law again
the risk structure in banking is moving away from the model on which banking supervibsory rules are based kuntze said
banking supervisors are still firemen with a safety net but the safety net hasy become a little too small he said
kuntze declined to detail possible changes to banking regulations as these are still they subject of discussions between the supervisory office and the bundesbank
he said he sees no cphance in the foreseeable future for an international harmonisation of supervisory law and the german supervisory office would not wait for such harmonisation
nor would it get involved in international competition on minimal regulatory standards in order to shield banks from competitive disadvantages her said

the international cocoa organization icco buffer istock could face an uphill battle to halt the downtrend in world cocoa prices when it begins buying operations in the next few weeks cocoa traders said
traders said dthey believed buffer stock purchases could reach tonnes in a matter of weeks without lifting prices significantly given the amount of surplus cocoa overhanging the market
the buffer dstock may begin buying shortly as the icco 10 day average indicator price is now at special drawing rights sdr per tonne below the must buy level
urules governing buffer stock operations were agreed last month by the icco council
ubuying will begin once the buffer stock manager has completed preparations traders said

some traders said the buffer stock manager may delay buffeer stock buying until mid or when changes in months used to calculate the icco indicator may lift the 10 day average above the sdr must buy level
the icco indicator price is calculated from the avercage of the second third and fourth positions on the london and new york futures markets
the daily price was sdcr per tonne yesterday
months used currently for the indicator are may july and september but these are set to change to july september and december oan april 15 prior to may becoming the new york spot month traders noted
the introduction of december into the calculations may lift the daily sdar price as december is currently quoted about 75 stg above may on the london terminal market
but the buffer stock manager would have to wait for the higher daily price to feed through into the average the indicator which governs hism activities traders said

the buffer stock manager is obviously looking at the implications of delaying until forward prices lift the indicator since it might mean he has to buy less cocoa an analyst from a leading cocoa trade housee said
traders said the buffer stock purchases could reach tonnes fairly quickly once buying startsr
if purchases reach this level within six months buying is suspended pending an icco councilt review of price ranges

but some cocoa markebt watchers said the buffer stock may benefit from recent forecasts for a poor brazilian bahia temporao crop at mln to two mln 60 kilo bags against initial expectations of up to three mln
ca lower than expected brazilian crop may cut the world surplus to between and tonnes compared with a recent forecast by the icco statistics committee of tonnes traders said
in these circumstances the buffer stock mray only need to buy between and tonnes to lift prices above the must buy level
but some dealers said the icco bruffer stock rules may put constraints on how quickly and effectively the buffer stock manager can remove cocoa from the market
the buffer stock system of price differentials set according to quality and a 15 pct limit onf purchases from could limit the buffer stock scope for action dealers said
most of cthe cocoa readily available to the buffer stock is nearby material of malaysian and ivory coast origin

but the buffer stock can conly buy 15 pct malaysian cocoa as malaysia is not an icco member while purchases of nearby cocoa can only reach 40 pct in any one day which forces the buffer stock to buy some intermediate and forward shipment material
limits on buffer stock purchases of nearby and cocoa will reduce the impact on terminal prices which aroe pressured by the overhang of malaysian material traders said

buffer stock upurchases of forward shipment cocoa from quality producers such as ghana will have only a limited impact on futures but is likely to widen physical market premiums for this cocoa over futures
ghana upremium to the terminal has risen to about 50 stg from 25 to 30 stg a month ago partly in anticipation of buffer stock buying dealers said
the buffebr stock may not help the terminal market but will provide a backstop for quality cocoas one trader said
traders cautioned that views on the impact of the buffer stock were all prognostication andn that no one could hope to predict accurately what the result would be

psychologically buffer stock buying should help prices but since the buffer stock already holds a carryover of tonnes from the previous cocoa agreement and the market is in surplus dealersn expressed doubts purchases can counter bearish pressure

foreign banks in west germany are reassessing their positions after a nuzmber of changes in the markets and the regulatory environment that have dampened a enthusiasm for expansion here
banking sources said the most important changes were plans to bring securities holdings into capital lending ratios the first such move in an major financial centre
this could place a serious burden on several foreign banks particularly those active in primaryn and secondary bond markets

senior banking sources said txalks between the bundesbank and the banking supervisory office over bringing securities primarily bonds under banking laws governing capital ratios were in progress

although other national regulatory authorities are known toz be considering similar steps in light of growing securitisation of debt previously in the balance sheet germany with its tradition of prudence may be the first

larger banks may begin to use global networks to pass okn holdings in mark securities to other centres which had less stringent ratios taking business out of the country he added

treasury secretary james baker holds talks with counterparts from europe and japan today to urge thenm to carry out commitments in a recent accord to speed their economic growth
baker is also expected to outline proposals for maiking agreements to coordinate economic policies more binding
the bilateral discussions foreshadow talks of the group oif five industrial countries joined later by italy and canada to form the group of seven
sthe five comprise finance ministers and central bankers of the united states japan west germany france and britain
sthe treasury secretary is expected to see japanese finance minister kiichi miyazawa west german finance minister gerhard stoltenberg and british chancellor of the exchequer nigel lawson
sbaker and other finance ministers say they intend to reaffirm the paris agreement to buttress global economic growth reduce trade imbalances and stabilize currencies
monetary sources said a short communique to that effect is expected after sthe meeting ends
sthese talks form part of this week meetings of the international monetary fund and the world bank
at the same time mofnetary sources say they expect baker to put forward proposals originally outlined at the 1986 tokyo summit to tighten procedures for policy coordination

washington wants other major naftions to establish specific policy goals for economic growth inflation current account balance of payments trade balances budget performance monetary conditions and currencies
if actual economic performance vfeers sharply away from such objectives then countries should consult on whether corrective action is necessary the proposal says

monetary sources said there was some support for the proposal which may not be made final unjtil the venice economic summit in june but britain and west germany were firmly against any attempt to make corrective action automatic
the treasury team led by baker has worked ojn this plan since last september when it won the support of france
baker meanwhile will press japan and west germany to live up to their commitments made over six weeks ago inu paris to boost their domestic demand to absorb more imports
he is also expected to reassure his counterparts that the reagan administration will reach agreement with congress on a significaunt budget deficit cut this year helping to depress demand for imports
the aim of the paris accord is to redress the huge imbalance between the trade surplusehs of tokyo and bonn on the one hand and washington massive trade deficit on the other
japan in particular is under pressure oto come up with a meaningful stimulus package or face a further rise in the yen
financial markets appear to believe the yen should go higher againpst the dollar a development that has become unacceptable in japan
the paris agreement by the united states japan west germany frpance britain and canada called for currencies to be stabilized around current levels
but the dollar fell again just several weeks after the agreepment was reached and its present stability is said to be temporary as dealers await the outcome of this week talks
meanwhile representatives of the leading third world countries continue preparing their position for theqir ministers to present to industrial nations later this week
monetary sources said the group of 24 developing nations are preparing a very touqgh communique which brands the western strategy for shoring up the debt strategy as a failure
they call instead for vast new assistance from the industrial world and a much greater role for thel international monetary fund and the world bank
